business.headline: Sensex and Nifty turn positive after early fall; IndusInd bank down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.12 points to 79,537.62, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 43.85 points to 24,169.40 as of 9:36 am.

Gold's record rally continues as Trump's Fed chief criticism sinks Wall StreetTrump reiterated his call for an immediate reduction in interest rates on Monday, warning that the US economy could face a slowdown, while criticising Powell's stance to keep rates unchanged until clarity on the inflation impact of Trump's tariff plans.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty to open flat after Wall Street crash?While Sensex and Nifty ended the previous session at their highest levels since January 6, the sharp fall in US markets overnight may cap gains during early trade on Tuesday.

Stocks to watch on April 22: HUL, HCLTech, Coal India, Paytm, Mazagaon DockShares of HCLTech, Waaree Energies, and Tata Communications will be in focus as they are set to announce their quarterly results today.

Dow Jones tumbles nearly 1,000 points as US stock markets crashTrump on Monday repeated his criticism of Fed Chair Jerome Powell and said the US economy could slow down unless interest rates are lowered immediately.

Former Fortis promoter Shivinder Singh files personal insolvency: ReportSingh has invoked Section 94 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC), which allows individuals to file for insolvency if they are unable to repay debts. In his plea, Singh stated that his liabilities now exceed the value of his remaining assets.
Sensex, Nifty rise over 1% in fifth-day rally led by banking, IT gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 855.30 points to close at 79,408.50, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 273.90 points to end at 24,125.55.

Klaus Schwab steps down as World Economic Forum chairThe WEF thanked Schwab for his 55 years of dedicated leadership and for building what has become a premier global platform for dialogue and progress.

India hopes to seal US trade pact this year: Finance Minister Nirmala SitharamanNirmala Sitharaman is on a five-day trip to the United States, where she will attend the spring meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, and the meeting of G20 finance ministers and central bank governors.

HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank hit record highs after strong Q4: Buy, hold or sell?HDFC Bank rose 1.3% while ICICI Bank gained 0.9% by 9:40 am. Their gains helped lift the Nifty Bank and Nifty Private Bank indices by nearly 2%, and pushed the Nifty 50 up 0.6%, with heavyweight HDFC Bank emerging as the index's top driver.

Sensex soars 1,000 points: Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: The rally on Monday marks the fifth straight session of gains, showing that investor confidence is returning. Both Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels since January 6.

Explained: Why Yes Bank share price rose nearly 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock was trading at Rs 18.95 on the BSE, marking a 4.75% jump. Gains continued through the morning, with the stock touching an intraday high of Rs 19.37, indicating that it rallied nearly 7%.

Stock market rally: Should investors consider small-cap, mid-cap stocks?With strong institutional inflows and improved breadth in the market, analysts say the coming weeks could favour investors who are selectively increasing exposure to quality names in the midcap and smallcap universe.

Gold price nears Rs 1 lakh-mark amid global uncertainty. Should you buy or sell?Gold price today: Monday's jump follows a dip in the previous session, where MCX Gold fell 0.44% to Rs 95,239 due to profit booking. But the broader narrative remains dominated by geopolitical and macroeconomic anxiety.

'Era of salaryman is over': Saurabh Mukherjea warns India's middle classSpeaking on a recent podcast titled Beyond the Paycheck: India's Entrepreneurial Rebirth, Saurabh Mukherjea issued a clear and unsettling warning: salaried employment, long considered the golden path to financial security, is dying.
Sensex, Nifty rally as strong Q4 results from banks lift market confidenceThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 635.70 points to 79,188.90, while the NSE Nifty50 added 200.30 points to 24,051.95 as of 10:33 am.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty continue their winning rally?Sensex, Nifty today: While strong results from HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank may help, weak global cues and disappointing Q4 results from Infosys could hold back gains.

Stocks to watch on April 21: TCS, Infosys, Gensol Engineering, HDFC Bank, IndigoShares of several major companies such as TCS, Inofsys, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, BHEL, Gensol Engineering, IndiGo, among others, will be in focus on April 21.

Gensol faces government inquiry after Rs 975 crore EV loan misuse: SourcesAccording to sources, the MCA's move is an independent action aimed at investigating potential corporate governance lapses and financial irregularities. There is no fixed timeline for the inquiry.

India-US trade talks from April 23, tariffs, customs negotiations on agenda: ReportThe Indian official team is visiting the US to give further impetus to the negotiations in the 90-day tariff pause window and discuss these terms of reference to iron out differences on certain issues.

Ford pauses shipments of SUVs, sports cars and other models to ChinaFord has halted exports of key US-built vehicles to China amid rising tariffs and trade tensions, impacting a once-profitable segment of its business, WSJ reports. Engine shipments, however, continue.
No GST on UPI transactions over Rs 2,000, government clarifiesUPI payments, especially those made to merchants, currently don't attract any extra charges like GST.

ICICI Bank cuts FD and savings rates. Check what's newIf you have a savings account with ICICI Bank, you'll now earn slightly less. For balances below Rs 50 lakh, the new interest rate is 2.75% per annum, down from 3%.

Infosys lets go of 240 new recruits, offers free upskilling: ReportThe impacted employees joined the company in October 2024 as part of a training batch. The freshers were hired for two roles; System Engineers (SE) and Digital Specialist Engineers (DSE).

Nvidia to keep serving Chinese firms despite massive AI chip export lossHuang's statement comes at a time when the United States has tightened rules around exporting advanced chips to China. The restrictions, announced under the Donald Trump administration, are part of an ongoing trade war between the two countries.

Want to change your tax regime while filing ITR? Here's what you should knowLet's say you had earlier chosen the old tax regime, but now the new regime appears more beneficial after reviewing your finances. Can you change it when filing your ITR? Let's find out here.

TCS denies job bias against US employees, calls allegations 'misleading': ReportThe complaints have mostly come from workers in the US who are over 40 and not of non-South Asian ethnic backgrounds. They believe TCS chose them for layoffs during the tech industry slowdown, while keeping younger Indian workers on H-1B visas.

How Jaggi brothers squandered borrowed money, killed BluSmartSebi's interim order exposed how the Jaggi brothers may have taken investors for a ride, not in an EV, but in a web of financial mismanagement.
Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

entertainment.headline: Rohit Shetty addresses rift with SRK after Dilwale: We have mutual respectFilmmaker Rohit Shetty broke his silence on his alleged rift with Shah Rukh Khan. The director

Actor Vishnu Vishal, badminton player Jwala Gutta welcome baby girlTamil actor Vishnu Vishal and badminton player Jwala Gutta became parents to a baby girl recently. The actor announced the happy news on social media.

Preity Zinta all smiles as Virat Kohli shows Vamika, Akaay's pics after IPL matchThe RCB vs PBKS match on April 20 turned memorable after a viral video featured fun banter between Virat Kohli and Preity Zinta.

Kanye West admits incestuous relationship with cousin: Showed him dirty magazinesKanye West opened up about having a sexual encounter with a male cousin, who is now in prison. He shared his music video, Cousins, on X along with his story.

ED summons actor Mahesh Babu for questioning on April 27 in money laundering caseActor Mahesh Babu has been summoned by the ED for questioning on April 27 in a money laundering probe. The investigation is linked to Hyderabad-based real estate firms accused of fraudulent land deals and unaccounted cash transactions.

Kesari 2 box office Day 4: Akshay Kumar's film stays steady on first MondayAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2,' co-starring R Madhavan and Ananya Panday, released on April 18 and opened with around Rs 7.75 crore. In just four days of its release, the film has earned Rs 34 crore.

Rajinikanth delights fans, waves at them from moving car at Jailer 2 shoot. WatchSuperstar Rajinikanth is presently shooting for director Nelson Dilipkumar's 'Jailer 2' in Kerala. He made his fans happy as he greeted them with a big smile on his face on the film's shooting spot.

George Clooney calls himself 'luckiest' in 10-year fight-free marriage with AmalHollywood actor George Clooney revealed that he and his wife, Amal, never fought in their 10-year-long marriage. He further spoke about how their close friends and family are shocked to learn about how they have never argued in their relationship.

'Andor' Season 2: The most grounded chapter in Star Wars history is backAndor Season 2 premieres on Disney+, offering a grounded, emotional take on the Star Wars universe. With strong writing and rich characters, it explores rebellion through everyday heroes, not Jedi legends.

New Oscar rules require voters to watch every nominee, support refugee filmmakersThe Academy now requires Oscar voters to watch all nominated films in a category. New rules support refugee filmmakers, clarify AI use, and introduce future awards for casting and stunt design

Bhabiji... actor Shubhangi Atre's ex-husband Piyush Poorey dies in IndoreShubhangi Atre's former husband, Piyush Poorey, passed away after battling liver cirrhosis in Indore. The actor was not on talking terms with her husband after their divorce earlier this year.

Rapper Hanumankind shares glimpse of debut Coachella performance. WatchRapper Hanumankind made his US debut at Coachella 2025 and shared his journey to the festival on Instagram, showcasing his experiences from rehearsals to the stage.

Who Is Dylan Meyer? All About Kristen Stewart's WifeFrom secret scripts to shared vows, Kristen Stewart and Dylan Meyer's Hollywood love story turns a new page with an intimate LA wedding, blending romance, creativity, and quiet celebration.

Justin Bieber's Coachella 2025 videos make fans worried about singer's healthJustin Bieber's recent Coachella 2025 appearance has sparked concern among fans due to videos showing him disoriented and erratic, raising questions about his health and well-being.

Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava crosses Rs 600 crore-mark on Day 66 despite OTT releaseVicky Kaushal's film 'Chhaava' continues to dominate the box office even after its Netflix release, crossing Rs 600 crore in just 66 days. It is the third Hindi film to reach the milestone.

BLACKPINK Jennie gets emotional during Coachella, says 'Mom, I Love You'BLACKPINK member Jennie gave an electric solo performance at Coachella 2025. She had an emotional moment mid-performance and said "Mom, I love you" in Korean.

K-pop group SEVENTEEN announces album Happy Burstday ahead of 10 year anniversaryK-pop sensation SEVENTEEN has unveiled their fifth album 'Happy Burstday', set to release on May 26. The group also announced an upcoming tour and additional content.

Sinners hits $61 million worldwide in opening weekend, matches to Minecraft MovieWarner Bros 'Sinners', starring Michael B Jordan and Hailee Steinfeld, debuted to $61 million globally, aligning with overseas expectations. Meanwhile, 'A Minecraft Movie' continues its robust box office run, nearing $721 million worldwide.

Sparsh Shrivastava admits to being stereotyped: But I have different perspectiveActor Sparsh Shrivastava discusses dealing with stereotyping in the film industry. He also expressed that the labels should be removed, citing example of how veteran actors used to do specific roles multiple times.

general news.headline: Ex-Karnataka top cop's wife googled death by neck vein cuts before murder: SourcesPallavi, wife of ex-Karnataka DGP Om Prakash, allegedly researched fatal neck injuries before fatally stabbing him at their Bengaluru home. She was arrested and their daughter Kriti is undergoing psychiatric evaluation.​

'Disgruntled employees': Trump defends Pentagon chief amid military leaks rowTrump and the White House defended Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth after reports he shared sensitive military info via Signal. Officials blamed disgruntled staff, denying any classified data was compromised.

JD Vance and family at Amber Fort, receive traditional Rajasthani welcomeUS Vice President JD Vance, currently on a four-day official visit to India, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday and hailed him as a "great leader". Strengthening bilateral ties between the two democracies is at the heart of Vance's agenda during this high-profile trip. This morning, Vice President Vance arrived in Jaipur, Rajasthan, where he is scheduled to explore the city's rich cultural heritage. He will visit Amber Fort at 9 am on Tuesday, followed by a keynote address on US-India relations at the Rajasthan International Centre (RIC) at 3 pm. The Vice President is staying at the historic Rambagh Palace during his Jaipur leg. Accompanying him on the visit are his wife, Usha Vance, their children, and a delegation of senior officials from the US administration.

Meet the 4 Indian cardinals who will be part of conclave to elect new PopeAmong the 135 cardinals eligible to vote for the next Pope are four from India, including two from the southern state of Kerala.

Would you 'eco-dump' someone in 2025?According to a new survey by happn, a dating app, 60% of singles now say sustainability is a green flag, quite literally. So, if you're recycling religiously, bringing your own tote bag to the farmers' market, and ordering oat milk without flinching, congrats. You just became more dateable.

Harvard sues Trump administration over $2.2 billion funding freezeHarvard University is suing the Trump administration to block a $2.2 billion federal grant freeze, calling it retaliation for refusing demands to curb campus activism and implement political reforms.

'You'll be killed like your father': Baba Siddique's son gets death threatZeeshan Siddique, son of former state minister Baba Siddique, who was shot last year, received a death threat through his email. Zeeshan has received several such death threats ever since his father's murder.

Watch: Delta plane catches fire at Orlando airport, passengers evacuate on slidesPassengers on a Delta flight evacuated using emergency slides after an engine caught fire at Orlando airport. No injuries were reported. The FAA is investigating the cause, and Delta arranged another plane to take passengers to their destination.

Kanye West admits incestuous relationship with cousin: Showed him dirty magazinesKanye West opened up about having a sexual encounter with a male cousin, who is now in prison. He shared his music video, Cousins, on X along with his story.

'We are open to peace': Putin's first call for Ukraine talks in yearsRussian President Vladimir Putin proposed bilateral peace talks with Ukraine, expressed openness to ceasefires, and emphasized dialogue

Watch: PM Modi spends time with JD Vance's children, gifts them peacock feathersPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday gifted peacock feathers to US Vice President JD Vance's children — Ewan, Vivek, and Mirabel — as part of a warm and personalised welcome at his residence, 7 Lok Kalyan Marg.

The gesture came during a light-hearted interaction where the Prime Minister was seen showing the Vance family around. A video from the visit shows the Prime Minister playfully engaging with Ewan and Vivek, who were seen sitting on his lap and chatting with him.

The Vance family — JD, Usha, and their three children — are in India on an official four-day visit. On Tuesday, they will visit Jaipur, followed by a trip to the iconic Taj Maha on Wednesday.

Bhogle, Doull kept away from KKR vs GT after curator controversyPopular commentators Harsha Bhogle and Simon Doull were absent from KKR's home game against Gujarat Titans on Monday, April 21. Bhogle and Doull were involved in a controversy with Eden curator Sujan Mukherjee at the start of the season.

Actor Vishnu Vishal, badminton player Jwala Gutta welcome baby girlTamil actor Vishnu Vishal and badminton player Jwala Gutta became parents to a baby girl recently. The actor announced the happy news on social media.

Mark Carney urges strong mandate to counter Trump, liberals leading April 28 pollsMark Carney, leading in polls ahead of the April 28 election, urged voters to give him a strong mandate to counter Trump's tariff threats and reshape Canada's economy.

Nashik water crisis: Planning, execution or funds — what's holding back relief?In Borichibari village of Nashik's Peth taluka, water isn't just scarce, it's a daily battle. As wells run dry, women risk health and safety trekking miles for every bucket. This ground report from Borichibari uncovers the toll water scarcity takes on lives, livelihoods, and futures.

Muslim employer helps Hindu couple marry in riot-hit MurshidabadMurshidabad's Domkal town saw a display of communal harmony when Muslim brick kiln owners and the community helped fund the marriage of a Hindu couple who worked for them.

Tiger first or human traditions? Why a boy met death in RanthamboreKnown for its majestic tigers, Ranthambore now cries for visionary rescue from the ever-expanding human footprint in the name of religion and safari and wedding tourism

PM hosts JD Vance in Delhi, both welcome significant progress in trade dealPrime Minister Narendra Modi met US Vice President JD Vance and his family at his official residence in Delhi. Both leaders discussed issues of mutual interest and welcomed the "significant progress" in the first phase of the bilateral trade deal.

Twist in Bengaluru road rage? CCTV shows Air Force officer assaulting manCCTV footage of a road rage incident in Bengaluru shows IAF officer's alleged attack. The officer had posted a video on social media showing his bloodied face, saying he was attacked by a local resident, while his wife was abused.

Columbia activist's wife gives birth, says husband denied release to be presentNoor Abdalla gave birth to her son in New York while her husband, Mahmoud Khalil, remained in ICE detention in Louisiana. Despite requests, he was denied permission to attend. Abdalla stated she will continue to advocate for his release and their family's reunion.

Preity Zinta all smiles as Virat Kohli shows Vamika, Akaay's pics after IPL matchThe RCB vs PBKS match on April 20 turned memorable after a viral video featured fun banter between Virat Kohli and Preity Zinta.
Sensex and Nifty turn positive after early fall; IndusInd bank down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.12 points to 79,537.62, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 43.85 points to 24,169.40 as of 9:36 am.

Pope Francis died of stroke, irreversible heart failure: Vatican doctorPope Francis died early Monday after suffering a stroke and heart failure, according to a death certificate released by Vatican doctor Andrea Arcangeli. The document noted he fell into a coma before passing.

Trump's approval hits new low as Americans feel he abuses authority: PollUS President Donald Trump's approval rating has dipped to 42%, its lowest since his return to office, a Reuters/Ipsos poll shows. Many Americans are uneasy with his use of power, fearing he's overreaching in key areas like universities and culture.

sports.headline: LSG vs DC: Revitalised KL Rahul out to hurt his former franchise LucknowAfter an unceremonious exit from LSG, KL Rahul returns to his former stomping ground, revitalised and with a point to prove. Will Rahul come back to haunt his former team, this time in the colours of DC?

Steve Waugh on Rohit's future as Test captain: Can't be complacent or relaxedLegendary Australia captain Steve Waugh has shared his thoughts on Rohit Sharma's future in the Indian Test team and said that the India skipper needs to ask himself if he has the hunger and desire to play the longest format.

Anaya Bangar chills with Sarfaraz Khan and his father, Musheer misses reunionFormer Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar's child Anaya Bangar spent time with Sarfaraz Khan and his family, and posted pictures featuring some precious moments with them.

KKR vs GT: Kolkata need to rethink overrated tactics to mount IPL 2025 comebackIPL 2025, KKR vs GT: Anil Kumble and Mark Boucher were critical of Kolkata's tactic of tinkering with their batting lineup after the 39-run defeat to the Gujarat Titans at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Shubman, Sai and Buttler made pitch look easy during their batting: Sai KishoreGujarat Titans (GT) spinner Sai Kishore credited captain Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan and Jos Buttler for making the pitch look easy during their batting against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). GT beat KKR by 39 runs at Eden Gardens.

Rashid Khan's return to form has lifted the morale of Gujarat Titans: Sai KishoreIPL 2025, KKR vs GT: In the post-match press conference, Sai Kishore praised Rashid Khan after the Afghan leg-spinner returned to form with figures of 4-0-25-2 against the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Is leg-spin Andre Russell's kryptonite in IPL? KKR mentor Dwayne Bravo respondsKKR mentor Dwayne Bravo doesn't feel that leg-spin is Andre Russell's weakness in the IPL after their loss to GT. Russell was dismissed by Rashid Khan during the game at the Eden Gardens.

Mondo Duplantis 2nd track and field star after Usain Bolt to win Laureus top honourPole Vault star Mondo Duplantis became the second track and field athlete after Usain Bolt to win the Laureus Sportsman Of The Year award on Monday, April 21. Apart from Duplantis, Simone Biles and Lamine Yamal were also honoured.

KKR captain Rahane blames Narine, Gurbaz after meek surrender vs GujaratKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane blamed openers Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Sunil Narine for the team's loss against Gujarat Titans at the Eden Gardens. Rahane asked his players to be brave from the next game.

14 runs off 19 balls in 199 chase: KKR fans slam Venkatesh IyerVenkatesh Iyer caught the ire of Kolkata Knight Riders' fans after a horror show with the bat against Gujarat Titans at the Eden Gardens. Iyer scored 14 off 19 balls in 199 chase.

Clinical Gujarat hammer hapless Kolkata to tighten grip on top spotIPL 2025, KKR vs GT: Shubman Gill's Gujarat Titans beat Ajinkya Rahane's Kolkata Knight Riders by 39 runs at the Eden Gardens to secure their sixth win of the competition and strengthened their grip on the top of the points table.

Apart from Duplantis, Simone Biles and Lamine Yamal were also honoured.

KKR captain Rahane blames Narine, Gurbaz after meek surrender vs GujaratKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane blamed openers Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Sunil Narine for the team's loss against Gujarat Titans at the Eden Gardens. Rahane asked his players to be brave from the next game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
